title: John Cleese Interview
overview: An interview with the man himself, as he tells all about the making of each of the episodes of Fawlty Towers and the writing process behind them as well as the good and bad moments from behind the scenes.

title: Andrew Sachs Interview
overview: An interview with the legendary actor Andrew Sachs, in which he tells us about his time on the show and of how the much loved character of Manuel was created.

title: A Visit to Torquay: Home of Fawlty Towers
Cheap Tatty Review
overview:
'Cheap Tatty Review' was filmed as introduction to the first episode of 'Not The Nine O'Clock News', the show that was supposed to begin the week after the penultimate episode of 'Fawlty Towers'. However 'Not The Nine O'Clock News' was postponed until later in 1979 due to the imminent General Election. 

The sketch was aired when the final episode of 'Fawlty Towers' was shown during the first series of 'Not The Nine O'Clock News'.

title: The Grange
overview: Pictures of the "real" Fawlty Towers hotel.  After being burnt down, the Grange housing estate was built in its place.

title: 2009 Interviews
overview: John Cleese & other principals tell the stories behind the creation of the series.

title: Polly! What have you done to my hotel?
overview: A very short film showing pictures of the demolished "Grange", the hotel featured in the opening title sequence and for exteriors of "Fawlty Towers"

title: The Fawlty Towers Building in Ashes
overview: A look at the building used as the hotel in Fawlty Towers after it was damaged by a fire. This video was an easter egg on the Fawlty Towers DVD. After the fire, it was purchased by developers. Eight houses now stand in its place, though there was planning permission for a 39 bed hotel.

title: John Cleese on the Making of Fawlty Towers
overview: A BBC interview with John Cleese about the making of Fawlty Towers.

title: A Touch of Class
overview: A confidence trickster comes to stay at the hotel, just after Basil has taken an ad in a posh magazine to upgrade the clientele.

title: The Builders
overview: The Fawltys take a holiday and leave Polly and Manuel to run the place just as O'Reilly's builders come to redo the lobby.

title: The Wedding Party
overview: Basil wants 'none of that' going on in his rooms and suspects some guests and Polly of carrying on.

title: The Hotel Inspectors
overview: Some inspectors are in town and Basil gets paranoid, so he alternately fawns over and offends his guests.

title: Gourmet Night
overview: To bring the right type of crowd into the hotel Basil establishes a Gourmet Night.

title: The Germans
overview: Sybil goes into the hospital for toe surgery, leaving Basil to cope with a fire drill single-handed. After a couple of blows on the head, Basil tells some German guests where Germany went wrong in WWII.

title: Communication Problems
overview: A selectively deaf woman named Mrs Richards insists that she has had a large amount of money stolen at the hotel, and against Sybil's wishes Basil puts a fiver on Dragonfly.

title: The Psychiatrist
overview: A psychiatrist and his wife come to stay and Basil thinks Sybil is telling them all about his life.

title: Waldorf Salad
overview: An American and his wife get unsatisfactory service at Fawlty Towers when he orders a Waldorf salad, after the kitchen has closed.

title: The Kipper and the Corpse
overview: Unknown to Basil, a guest dies in the night and he tries to serve him breakfast anyway and an obnoxious woman insists on service for her dog.

title: The Anniversary
overview: Sybil leaves before Basil's surprise anniversary party and Basil spends the evening trying to convince their friends she's ill.

title: Basil the Rat
overview: The health inspector is coming and Basil tells Manuel to get rid of his pet rat, which he later finds out is named Basil.

title: John Cleese and Andrew Sachs in We Are Most Amused
overview:
Phillip Schofield and John Cleese introduce a spectacular night of comedy celebrating HRH the Prince of Wales's 60th birthday in aid of his youth charity, the Prince's Trust. 
Featuring top comedy names from Britain and abroad, including Robin Williams, who returns to the UK stage for the first time in 27 years, Rowan Atkinson, musician and stand-up Bill Bailey, Joan Rivers, and stand-ups Michael McIntyre and Omid Djalili, while Chris Tarrant and Fern Britton guest star in specially-written sketches. 
Plus, a surprise musical number from a visiting comedy great.

title: The Interviews
overview:
Interviews with John Cleese, Connie Booth, Andrew Sachs, Prunella Scales, John Howard Davies, Bernard Cribbins, Geoffrey Palmer, Sabina Franklyn, Nicky Henson & David Kelly. 

Originally filmed for 'Fawlty Towers Revisited'

title: Fawlty Towers Re-Opened
overview:
To help celebrate its 30th anniversary, G.O.L.D. is throwing open the doors of TV's most famous hotel once more after a lengthy absence.

New and exclusive, Fawlty Towers: Re-opened gathers cast and crew together to retrace the history of the sitcom from a rarely seen insider point of view. The one-off special leaves no English Riviera stone unturned in its search for trivia and nuggets of information from the Fawlty Towers guestbook, together with in-depth interviews with John Cleese, Andrew Sachs and Prunella Scales, as well as Connie Booth talking about her memories from the show for the first time in 30 years. Just don't mention the war.

title: Basil's Best Bits
overview: Now here's an interesting way to celebrate the 30th birthday of a classic sitcom. For the first time ever, John Cleese reveals his favourite scenes from Fawlty Towers. No clues yet as to which ones they will be but there's the added bonus of the likes of Michael Palin, Terry Jones, Mitchell and Webb, Eddie Izzard and AA Gill reminiscing about these magic moments. Possibly even more interesting will be the comments from the owners of Gleanagles Hotel, which was the real-life inspiration for Fawlty Towers.

title: 2016 Specsavers Commercial, "Fawlty Car"
overview: A 2016 commercial for Specsavers featuring John Cleese as Basil Fawlty, who is having some trouble with his car - again!

title: John Cleese Interview for 2016 Specsavers Commercial
overview: A behind-the-scenes interview with John Cleese for the 2016 Specsavers commercial featuring Basil Fawlty.
